cab.content: c364REPORT OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OP EDUCATION. Apart from administrative work and furtherconsideration of the Education Bill, the Staff of theDepartment and of the Victoria and Albert Museum havebeen engaged in making the best arrangements possible forthe transfer of the Board's Offices to South Kensington.at the request of the Director-General of national Service,drawing attention to the urgent necessity for an abundantsupply of labour for the land during the summer months,kid suggesting that boya should be allowed to offer theirservices for the purpose during term time or that thebummer holidays should be prolonged.X have issued a Circular to Secondary Schools,9th June, 1917.
